body.p: This page describes the ATF mechanism for linking a scholarly commentary to its base text.
Each ATF file that uses this mechanim must start include the protocol line:
at the top of each file, after the project declaration.
Within the transliteration of the text, use the following field designations:

dl.dd: to introduce a quote from the base text;
to introduce an observation from a commentary;

body.p: each of these elements is surround by white space.

The milestone ,b may be followed by a number, so that each ,b field designation within a single line of text has a unique identifier. The base text may then be identified in a comment line as follows:
body.pre: #,b1 = SB Anzu 1 = cams/anzu:Q002769 56 #,b2 = CT 19, pl.44, K 04226 = dcclt:P365422 o i 11
body.p: At the moment those notes don't do anything - but at some point in the future it may be possible to transform those into actual links. If the text referred to is not available anywhere on oracc (doesn't have a project name), and/or doesn't have a Q or P number, you may write those notes more informally - but obviously they will not result in a link.
This example is based on a real-life text but has been adapted to showcase all three field designations.
body.pre:
&P415763 = CM 31, 139
#project: cams/gkab #atf: use unicode #atf: use commentary #atf: lang akk-x-stdbab
@tablet @obverse
1. ,b BE iz-bu SAG.DU UR.MAH GAR NUN LUGAL{+tu₂} ŠU₂{+tu₂} DAB{+bat} #,b = SB Šumma Izbu 8 = cams/gkab:Q003013 1
2. ,b1 meṭ-lu-tu₂ DU{+ak} ,o me₂-eṭ-lu-tu₂ : ,b2 ši-bu-u₂-tu₂ : MIN li-tu-tu₂ ,z $ŠU $A x #,b1 = SB Šumma Izbu 8 = cams/gkab:Q003013 2 #,b2 = SB Šumma Izbu 9 = cams/gkab:Q003014 43
